lines.text: My father was a pharmacist. He died when I was twelve. My mother was unable to work. She had never given it a thought. She looked after the estate as best she could, which was not very well. It was depleted very quickly.

[continues]
How unpleasant it is to slowly become poor, to sink slowly into poverty,
Watch out. She's got a strong grip. She's a masseuse, and a good one.
I ordered Clos Vougeot and Moulis. Do you want some Savigny too?
It's very amusing to live several lives at once.
In the end, I found that people were generally quite kind.
That's surprising. Normally, people say the opposite.
If you lack the strength to fight, others can't do a thing for you.
Whenever you want. But I'd rather do other things for you.
What are you thinking? I'm a masseuse, before all ese.
Think of yourself now. Forget the past. Live in the present.
I want to be all yours.
You won't be mine, nor his. You're your own person.
Then I'm giving myself to you.
